intro: Ophrys × breviappendiculata, commonly known as the short-appendiculate bee orchid, is a hybrid orchid species native to parts of Europe. It is characterized by its specialized floral morphology, featuring a labellum that mimics the appearance of a female bee, a trait used to attract male bees for pollination. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish in color, with intricate patterns that enhance its mimicry. Ophrys × breviappendiculata is a rare and protected species, reflecting its ecological significance and conservation status.
